gmc_hdfs.replicationsimulator

Class Workload

  • java.lang.Object
    • gmc_hdfs.replicationsimulator.Workload
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Workload
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    workload class is component whose generate workload. It is a component which simulates the work load. Work load is a set of requests which are sent by the users to the system for accessing the data and processing them.
    Since:
    GMC_HDFSSim Toolkit 1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Workload() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      With executing this method, the workload is implemented to the system and it continues until the simulation is finished.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Workload

        public Workload()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        With executing this method, the workload is implemented to the system and it continues until the simulation is finished. The type and features of the workload should be written inside the function. In fact anything that is in this function will be executed. It is recommended that you should write functions for the work load and call the function inside the run function. Two important methods for creating the work load are written before in this class which will be introduced in the following.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
